content: biffer duster wig from gherkin s bucket materials size h us 8 crochet hook ¼ oz worsted weight kitchen cotton i used sugar n cream 1 ¼ oz machine-washable novelty yarn dependent upon type ~35 yards abbreviations chain chain single_crochet single_crochet ea each double_crochet double_crochet tfl through the front loops half_double_crochet half_double_crochet slip_stitch slip_stitch st - stitch repeat - repeat pattern chain 21 single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook single_crochet in ea chain across turn 20 single_crochet create round chain 2 counts as first st * double_crochet tfl of next 4 single_crochet half_double_crochet tfl in next 10 single_crochet double_crochet tfl in last 5 single_crochet chain 2 * turn work and repeat from * to * working in remaining loops from the row of single_crochet you just worked into i e what was the back loop of each stitch join with slip_stitch to first st of the round close round chain 1 does not count as first st single_crochet tbl of both sides of previous round all the way across this will create a pocket and leave a ridge to attach the novelty yarn to later turn 20 single_crochet repeat last two lines once more fasten_off and weave in ends copyright krysten l & gherkin s bucket 2007 don t steal my stuff y all it s for personal use only to bring joy to others give credit where credit is due selling the finished product for non-profit charity uses is ok attach novelty yarn to one loop of an edge stitch on the long side with a slip_stitch chain 10 loosely slip_stitch into loop of next st see note below * slip_stitch in loop of next stitch chain 10 loosely slip_stitch in loop of next st * repeat from * to * across at the end of the row chain 2 and turn continue back in the same manner through the ridge of loops you created when you closed the round repeat for 2nd ridge and the other side edge you will have four ridges of novelty yarn loops fasten_off and weave in ends slip prongs of swiffer duster into the two pockets and get dusting note that the first time you put it on it will be snug and may require some scooching to get the handle prongs all the way in note use my directions for the fringe as a guide if you have particularly bulky novelty you may need to adjust these directions try making your chain length a little longer and slip stitching into every other loop etc it all just depends on how loose or compact you want the dusty part to be looser and longer fringe will allow for more corner and small places dusting compact and shorter fringe will make for a more scrubby duster you can also purchase these pre-made through my etsy shop for those of you who are less than crochet-inclined www gherkinsbucket etsy com copyright krysten l & gherkin s bucket 2007 don t steal my stuff y all
